Control Domain: Data Security and Privacy Lifecycle Management
Control Title: Security and Privacy Policy and Procedures
Control Specification:
Establish, document, approve, communicate, apply, evaluate and maintain policies and procedures for the classification, protection, preparation and handling of data throughout its lifecycle, and according to all applicable laws and regulations,standards, and risk level. Review and update the policies and procedures at
least annually.

Control Domain: Data Security and Privacy Lifecycle Management
Control Specification: Apply industry accepted methods for the secure disposal of data from storage media such that data is not recoverable by any forensic means.

Control Domain: Data Security and Privacy Lifecycle Management
Control Specification:
Create and maintain a data inventory, at least for any sensitive
data and personal data.

Control Domain: Data Security and Privacy Lifecycle Management
Control Specification: Classify data according to its type and sensitivity level.

Control Domain: Data Security and Privacy Lifecycle Management
Control Specification: Create data flow documentation to identify what data is processed, stored or transmitted where. Review data flow documentation at defined intervals, at least annually, and after any change.

Control Domain: Data Security and Privacy Lifecycle Management
Control Specification: Document ownership and stewardship of all relevant documented personal and sensitive data. Perform review at least annually.

Control Domain: Data Security and Privacy Lifecycle Management
Control Title: Data Protection by Design and Default
Control Specification: Develop systems, products, and business practices based upon a principle of security by design and industry best practices.

Control Domain: Data Security and Privacy Lifecycle Management
Control Title: Data Privacy by Design and Default
Control Specification: Develop systems, products, and business practices based upon a principle of privacy by design and industry best practices. Ensure that systems' privacy settings are configured by default, according to all applicable laws and regulations.

Control Domain: Data Security and Privacy Lifecycle Management
Control Specification:
Conduct a Data Protection Impact Assessment (DPIA) to evaluate the origin, nature, particularity and severity of the risks upon the processing of personal data, according to any applicable laws, regulations and industry
best practices.

Control Domain: Data Security and Privacy Lifecycle Management
Control Specification: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures that ensure any transfer of personal or sensitive data is protected from unauthorized access and only processed within scope as permitted by the respective laws and regulations.

Control Domain: Data Security and Privacy Lifecycle Management
Control Title: Personal Data Access, Reversal, Rectification and Deletion
Control Specification: Define and implement, processes, procedures and technical measures to enable data subjects to request access to, modification, or deletion of their personal data, according to any applicable laws and regulations.

Control Domain: Data Security and Privacy Lifecycle Management
Control Title: Limitation of Purpose in Personal Data Processing
Control Specification: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures to ensure that personal data is processed according to any applicable laws and regulations and for the purposes declared to the data subject.

Control Domain: Data Security and Privacy Lifecycle Management
Control Specification: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures for the transfer and sub-processing of personal data within the service supply chain, according to any applicable laws and regulations.

Control Domain: Data Security and Privacy Lifecycle Management
Control Specification: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures to disclose the details of any personal or sensitive data access by sub-processors to the data owner prior to initiation of that processing.

Control Domain: Data Security and Privacy Lifecycle Management
Control Specification:
Obtain authorization from data owners, and manage associated risk
before replicating or using production data in non-production environments.

Control Domain: Data Security and Privacy Lifecycle Management
Control Specification:
Data retention, archiving and deletion is managed in accordance with
business requirements, applicable laws and regulations.

Control Domain: Data Security and Privacy Lifecycle Management
Control Specification:
Define and implement, processes, procedures and technical measures
to protect sensitive data throughout its lifecycle.

Control Domain: Data Security and Privacy Lifecycle Management
Control Specification: The CSP must have in place, and describe to CSCs the procedure to manage and respond to requests for disclosure of Personal Data by Law Enforcement Authorities according to applicable laws and regulations. The CSP must give special attention to the notification procedure to interested CSCs, unless otherwise prohibited, such as a prohibition under criminal law to preserve confidentiality of a law enforcement investigation.

Control Domain: Data Security and Privacy Lifecycle Management
Control Specification: Define and implement, processes, procedures and technical measures to specify and document the physical locations of data, including any locations in which data is processed or backed up.

Control Domain: Data Security and Privacy Lifecycle Management
Control Specification:
Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures to: 
1) Document and trace data sources, and 2) Make the data source available according to legal and regulatory requirements

Control Domain: Data Security and Privacy Lifecycle Management
Control Specification:
Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures to: 
1) validate data sources
2) establish a baseline to capture characteristics of what data is expected 
3) determine and monitor the variations and deviations from the expected baseline.

Control Domain: Data Security and Privacy Lifecycle Management
Control Specification:
Based on risk and privacy impact analysis and business use cases, adopt Privacy Enhancing Technologies such as differential privacy, federated learning, etc.

Approved: Use Privacy Enhancing Technologies for training data, informed by risk and privacy impact analysis and business use cases

Control Domain: Data Security and Privacy Lifecycle Management
Control Specification: Regularly validate the consistency and conformity of training/fine-tuning or augmentation data (e.g. data used RAG). Implement dataset versioning to ensure traceability and enforce restrictions to prevent unauthorized changes.

Control Domain: Data Security and Privacy Lifecycle Management
Control Specification:
Enhance the variety in training datasets for AI models by including a broad spectrum of examples and scenarios to improve model robustness and fairness, reducing biases and improving performance.

Approved: Ensure that sufficient variety in training datasets for AI models while taking into consideration geographical, contextual, behavioural or functional settings of the inded use of the AI system.
